perturbation.original_text: 2.01 Term. This agreement shall commence on January 20, 2014 (the "Effective Date") and shall continue in effect for six (6) months (the "Initial Term"). This agreement shall automatically renew for successive six (6) month periods unless written notice is provided of either party's intent not to renew at least six (6) months before the end of the then-current term.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.01 Term. This agreement shall commence on January 20, 2014 (the "Effective Date") and shall continue in effect for six (6) months (the "Initial Term"). This agreement will renew for successive six (6) month periods only upon mutual written agreement by both parties at least one (1) month before the end of the then-current term.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stated the agreement auto-renews unless cancelled with six months notice. The modified version states that renewal requires mutual written agreement. This creates a contradiction regarding the renewal terms.

perturbation.original_text: 4.01 Service Fees. In consideration of providing the Services set forth in Exhibit B, the Company agrees to pay to Contractor [ ** ] percent ([ *∗ ]%]) of Company's Gross Invoiced Sales (the "Service Fees"). Company agrees to have Fesnak & Associates, LLP pay the Service Fees directly to Contractor. Service Fees shall be paid to Contractor within five (5) days after the end of each month.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.01 Service Fees. In consideration of providing the Services set forth in Exhibit B, the Company agrees to pay to Contractor [ ** ] percent ([ *∗ ]%]) of Company's Gross Invoiced Sales (the "Service Fees"). Company agrees to have Fesnak & Associates, LLP pay the Service Fees directly to Contractor. Service Fees shall be paid to Contractor within thirty (30) days after the end of each month.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stipulated that service fees are paid within five days of month end. The modification states they will be paid within thirty days. This creates a conflict and uncertainty about when payment is due, making enforcement difficult.

perturbation.original_text: 9.04 Assignment. This Agreement may not be assigned by either party without the prior written consent of the other party, except that, without such consent, (i) Company may make an assignment of this Agreement as collateral security in favor of its lenders, and (ii) the Company may assign this Agreement to a purchaser of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company's business related to the Products. Subject to the foregoing sentence, this Agreement shall bind and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.04 Assignment. This Agreement may be assigned by either party without the prior written consent of the other party. The contractor may not assign this agreement for any reason. Subject to the foregoing sentence, this Agreement shall bind and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their respective successors and assigns.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause stated that assignment is not allowed without the prior written consent of the other party. The modified version says both parties are allowed, except that the contractor may not assign this agreement for any reason. This creates conflict between the first and second sentences, leading to uncertainty about the assignment of the contract.
